text: Sir George de la Poer Beresford, 2nd Baronet (1 March 1811 – 11 February 1873) was an Irish Conservative politician, peer, and army officer. He was the son of Sir John Beresford, 1st Baronet and Mary née Molly and, in 1846, married Elizabeth Lucas, daughter of Davis Lucas. He had at least four children, including: Mary Beresford (died 1847); Marcia Mary Ann Harriet Wilhelmina de la Poer Beresford (died 1908); John Edward Francis de la Poer Beresford (1851–1854); and William Carr de la Poer Beresford (1858–188). He was elected Conservative MP for at the 1841 general election but was unseated just under a year later. At the ensuing by-election, he stood again but was unsuccessful. He succeeded to the Baronetcy of Bagnall in 1844 upon the death of his father. Upon his own death in 1873, the title was inherited by Henry Monson de la Poer Beresford-Peirse. He was also a member of the Travellers Club and White's. ==References== ==External links== * Category:UK MPs 1841–1847 Category:Irish Conservative Party MPs Category:Baronets in the Baronetage of the United Kingdom George Category:1811 births Category:1873 deaths
title: Sir George de la Poer Beresford, 2nd Baronet
